titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Caitlin Klein, 2011.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-06-07T14:14-0400

did.abstract: The Food Studies Ephemera Collection consists of pamphlets, recipe booklets, and other food- and cookery-related ephemera donated to Fales by various donors.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Collection use is subject to all copyright laws. Permission to publish materials must be obtained in writing from the Director of Fales Library and Special Collections. Please contact fales.library@nyu.edu. or call 212 998 2596.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open to researchers. Appointments are necessary for the use of manuscript and archival collections.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: The items in the Food Studies Ephemera Collection have been donated to NYU by a number of individuals from the general public. The Collection continues to expand as donations continue.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Food Studies Ephemera Collection consists of printed ephemera (primarily pamphlets and recipe booklets) having to do with food and cookery. The bulk of the materials are from the mid-twentieth century.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Collection is arranged alphabetically by subject. Because the Collection will continue to expand, there are no permanent box numbers.
